CatDescriptText: Mrs. Emma Goins, widow, 3251 Milwaukee Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 29, 1958 with question: "Do you think that taverns should be permitted to remain open past midnight on Saturdays?" answer reads: "For my part they should be closed all the time. I don't like them, because the people go into them and disgrace not only themselves, but others as well.  They get tanked-up and come out fighting and say things that they wouldn't say if they were sober."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Emma Goins, wearing dark button down coat with collar, eyeglasses, and dark hat, standing on sidewalk with automobiles and buildings in background
